message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DM 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the construction and analysis of locally repairable codes, which are used in distributed data storage. This topic is closely related to information theory (cs.IT) and coding theory (cs.CC). The paper also utilizes matroid theory, which falls under the category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The analysis of the bounds on the performance of LRCs involves combinatorial techniques, which could be classified under the sub-category of combinatorics (cs.DS). Finally, the paper's focus on improving existing results suggests that it could also be classified under the sub-category of systems and control (cs.SI).
